title: Important! About Keen rights (once again)
content:
I was browsing ROME.RO forums just for fun (and looking for all Keen related), and noticed the following stuff in one topic:
[quote]Quote:[hr]
.... Happy Birthday Keen, we'll never forget you (especially if Tom Hall comes to some sort of agreement with id, and we see Keen 3D). ....
libertycityrules
[hr][/quote]
[quote]Quote:[hr]
I thought Tom got rights to Keen from id already. Could be wrong.
Technician
[hr][/quote]

Then, soon after that:
[quote]Quote:[hr]
No, that was only for one game, which we decided not to do.
The Romero
[hr][/quote]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img]
So.. Was there something that Tom Hall was given the rights to do just a one new Keen game? That he wanted to make TUIT as trilogy or something, but got permission just for one, and refused because of that..?

And does this information read anywhere? I don't remember reading about this before. On the other hand, can be that I've just forgot this detail. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img]

Anyways.. Keen rights to Tom Hall! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Important! About Keen rights (once again)
content: I remember reading somewhere (i think CC314, i dont know) that Tom Hall would only make a new game if he had FULL rights to keen. That is, he won't just make a game if he knows the rights will be taken away after that.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: re:
content: I'm guessing that's referring to Keen Chronicles...

title: Re: re:
content: Keen Chronicles?
Oh, wow, Yowza, that's a blast from the past.  :-)  I'd completley forgotten about that.  Good call!

title: Re: !!
content: Awesome! Although Tom Hall is stupid for refusing. If he truly loves Keen, he'll release the damn game already![img]http://www.geocities.com/miniopolis/soul.txt[/img]

title: Re: !!
content:
A-hem...

[quote]Quote:[hr]...Tom Hall would only make a new game if he had FULL rights to keen...[hr][/quote][img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: !!
content:
That's why he's stupid.

After all, do you REALLY think ID would want to give FULL RIGHTS to Tom Hall? Their aim to make a profit. It's business. Not a matter of committment to their games. I'm just being realisitic.

Although if ID do make a new Keen game, i'd rather play on a handheld console and retain the classic gameplay of the original rather than on a next-gen console where the graphics are SSSSOOOO realistic that we wouldn't be able to tell the difference between a Shikadi and a Dopefish. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img] [img]http://www.geocities.com/miniopolis/soul.txt[/img]

title: Re: !!
content:
Yeah, me too.
PS3, whats that all about?? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img]

title: Re: !!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Although Tom Hall is stupid for refusing.[hr][/quote]
There might be good reason for refusing. Suppose he did go ahead and make one new Keen game and it's very successful, guess who 1: won't even think about giving Tom full rights, and 2: might decided they want to try to get some more money by making more Keen games. Do we really want ID (as they are today) to have anything to do with Keen?

title: Re: !!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Unfleex:
Although Tom Hall is stupid for refusing. If he truly loves Keen, he'll release the damn game already![hr][/quote]

I actually think the opposite of that. If Tom did have rights to produce one completly new Keen game (assuming it wasn't just the rights to release the exsisting games to pocket/ pc, as I'd read was the intention of the Keen Chronicals), then he wouln't have been able to complete TUIT, and like Zach said, if his new Keen game was successful, iD would just take the rights to make possible sequels (not so they can get rich off Tom's revival of Keen, so to speak, but simply because they only ever allowed Tom one game).

I think it shows that Tom truly loves Keen by holding out to get full rights, instead of just a one-off shot at making a new Keen with iD taking away Keen again as soon as that one game's finished.

And perhaps I've read the situation wrong like I sometimes do, but that's what I think. Feel free to take little to no notice of it at all.--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: !!
content: Either way, we're not getting a new Keen game anytime soon...[img]http://www.geocities.com/miniopolis/soul.txt[/img]

title: Re: !!
content:
Hmmm. Keen Chronicles. But wasn't that some plan to make Keens for some hand consoles or something? Not new game?

And yeah, I agree with SpikeNexus. Tom Hall wants to get the full rights to make more than one games, to complete the series with a new trilogy. (And possible more games after that. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] )
I can't even think what iD could do with Keen.. Keen Arena? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-bloody.gif[/img]

Well, now it's just time to wait. I'm sure iD will break eventually, sooner or later.. It may take a year, it may take 5, or a gargin' decade.. We'll drag Tom back from retirement if we have to. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: hehe
content:
It'd be wild if Tom was secretly viewing the mods we've created. It'd be light-years beyond awesome if he commented on a couple of them--or at the very least, our different Keen sprites. But odds are he's too busy for that sort of thing.

Either way, I have complete faith in him, and never-ending respect for his creations. Keen is one of those characters who resonates deeply with me--something many video game characters lack. Whatever Tom decides to do, he's got my full support. :-)[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

content:
What I think is he wanted rights to the Keen games also, not just over the Keen character (or vice versa, who knows). And I would really like to know how much the full rights over the character would cost.------------------------------------

title: Re: Important! About Keen rights (once again)
content:
I doubt we'll learn how much such a license would cost, unless maybe somebody made a serious offer to aquire it, or made an appointment discussing that, and I know none of us are in any position to do such a thing.

I think the rights to CK would mean both the games and the characters, since they're really the same intelectual property.
I'm talking about potential new games, not the existing games.
I'm not sure having those licenses would really be necesary... although maybe without them you couldn't refer to things that happened in them?
Maybe they the old games would automatically be included along with the license as a whole, but I pretty much doubt that considering Keen Dreams and Commander Keen (GBC).
What do I know!
Like I said, maybe if somebody had a serious talk with id we'd know.
Perhaps even "just" a talk with Tom Hall, considering he tried, but he probably doesn't want to discuss it.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: mods
content:
As far as I recall, somebody (either Flaose or JosephBurke) said something like this: iD is willing to turn a blind eye to our modding as long as we don't directly send them anything... I think. As long as we don't go too overboard and try to advertise these things, we should be okay.

Honestly, I think emailing any sort of mod to Tom Hall would be asking for trouble. If they're turning a blind eye to us now on good faith, the last thing we want to do is attract unnecessary attention.

title: Re: Important! About Keen rights (once again)
content:
I saw this topic pretty late. But after reading the whole topic there's one little thing to add; this new is not a big surprise. Don't forget that Tom Hall has mentioned several times in interviews that he would only make a new Keen game if he had the full rights, because otherwise Keen could be taken away from him if he was succesfull again. It's not strange that he reffered to an actual offer, probably years ago.

And I also think that that offer could have been Keen Chronicles.-----------------
[img]http://www.jamba.nl/storage/view/upload/logo/image_multijpeg/DevilFrogVerwandlung.jpg[/img][img]http://www.jamster.com/s/jiw/img/US_logo_big.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: well...
content: At the very least, even if Keen Chronicles was nothing but the first six games released again, it'd be good because 1) A commercial, legally obtainable version of Keen6 would become a reality, and 2) Commander Keen would get a brief burst of notariety again, even if just for 12 seconds on the internet.

title: Re: well...

"i say that everyone in the forum spam iD with tons of emails and telephone calls and letters and anything else you can think of demanding that the rights to Keen be given back to Tom Hall!"

"Dear iD. We've taken all your stuff. Everything will be toast(ed) if you don't give Tom Hall the Keen rights today at 1 am at the Riverstreet corner, near the hotel. --the Keen community"You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: haha
content: Humor aside, I think our best bet for the time being is to lay low.  Tom's told us multiple times that he'd love to make another Keen game, but it's just not the right time yet.  If he ever does get the rights, I vote we throw a huge block party for him.  ;-)

title: Re: eh... whoops!!!
content:
As for Keen's creators, I happened upon something new (at least for me) information on [url=http://www.athenshigh.com/1963/info/princebobby-i.html]Bobby Prince[/url].
The site is apparently his own tribute to the school, pretty much already indicated by the favicon used. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

While investigating his domains, I also found a site about what I think he is currently doing.
He and some others are publishing, or going to publish, artists' music, and they're looking for singers.
I don't have the name with me right now, and don't have time to look it up again.
(There wasn't anything on the site yet anyway.)Retodon8

title: Re: Important! About Keen rights (once again)
content:
Yep, it's him in the Eat Your Veggies video.
I suppose you didn't see [url=http://romero.smugmug.com/gallery/480/1/10004695]this[/url] before either then.
Besides the aforementioned, I don't think there are (m)any more pictures with BP in them.

I've tried to find out what he's doing these days (years) before, and basically reached the same [url=http://archive.gamespy.com/articles/december03/doom/where/index2.shtml]conclusion[/url].

Let me look it up now... yes, I used [url=http://www.internic.net/whois.html]this[/url] before, filled in "bpmusic.com", and found the mentioning of [url=http://www.musicwrights.com/]Music Wrights Publishing[/url].
That's what I mentioned earlier, what I think he's doing these days.

Late Edit... more about the Keen legacy than the rights, but oh well!

Some more Googling (I do that every now and again) got me [url=http://www.fusionindustries.com/content/images/gallery/photos/gdc2004/pa]this[/url].
Apparently Keen was put on a BIG screen during GDC 2004.
I suppose it was simply to show some of the past, nothing special.

I also found this [url=http://www.planetanachronox.com/features/chats/anox120700.shtml]old interview[/url] which actually includes some Tom quotes I don't recall having read.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: new quotes
content:
Ugh, IRC chat logs are always so hard for me to follow. :-) That one in particular had a lot of immature jokes... but was still an entertaining read--pre-game speculation is fun!

Thanks for the collection of stuff, though, Ret! Are you a journalist for Gamespy? Or were you simply saying that you reached the same conclusion the author of that article came to?

title: Re: Important! About Keen rights (once again)
content:

I guess he is not a journalist for Gamespy. Just good findin' stuff. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

title: Re: new quotes
content:
Trust me, I didn't read all of the log either. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I just searched for "keen", read on a bit, re-searched few times, and skipped the rest.
I agree, those logs are really hard to read; I'm always glad when somebody decides to clean them up and post a version with only the relevant stuff.

And no, I don't work for Gamespy. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I was only referring to the "we have no idea what he's up to. Believe us, we tried. Where are you, Bobby?", only in singular.
(Although sometimes we argue which one of use can write in singular.)
It was like he disappeared of the face of the earth.
The site I found seems pretty recent though, so apparently he's still here.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: The underground:
content:
*Meanwhile at Id headquarters...*

*An explosion rocks the building...*

Carmack: What the...?

Mort: Okay, nobody move! We're taking over!

Keen: Hand over all your palettes! And put your 3D rendering programs where I can see 'em!
